bug.author: alex-calderwood
bug.summary: Message in readme seems unnecessary (and wrong??)
bug.description:
The following line in the README seems to be unnecessary or deprecated. Using a Jupyter notebook, I didn't need to use force=True and it downloaded just fine with no prompt. In fact, when I did include the flag I got a message: unexpected argument 'force'. <denchmark-code># IMPORTANT: The above line prompts you before downloading, which doesn't work well in a Jupyter notebook. # To avoid a prompt when using notebooks, instead use: >>> stanza.download('en', force=True) </denchmark-code>
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: MacOS Python version: Python 3.8 from Anaconda Stanza version: stanza-1.0.0-py3

comments.comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alex-calderwood>@alex-calderwood</denchmark-link> ! That's indeed a mistake (it's intended for a previous version of the package). I've updated the README!
